verses.kjv: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.
verses.web: All the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.
verses.ct: The people of Judah chose Uzziah, who was 16 years old, and made him king to succeed his father Amaziah.

verses.kjv: He built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
verses.web: He built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
verses.ct: He rebuilt Eloth and brought it back under Judah's control after his father died.

verses.kjv: Sixteen years old was Uzziah when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
verses.web: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jechiliah, of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Uzziah was 16 when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 52 years. His mother was Jecoliah, who was from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Amaziah did.
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he did what was right, just as his father Amaziah had done.

verses.kjv: And he sought God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the visions of God: and as long as he sought the LORD, God made him to prosper.
verses.web: He set himself to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the vision of God; and as long as he sought LORD, God made him prosper.
verses.ct: He devoted himself to seeking God during the lifetime of Zechariah, a man who understood the visions of God. As long as Uzziah sought the LORD, God made him prosper.

verses.kjv: And he went forth and warred against the Philistines, and brake down the wall of Gath, and the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod, and built cities about Ashdod, and among the Philistines.
verses.web: He went out and fought against the Philistines, and broke down the wall of Gath, the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod; and he built cities in the country of Ashdod, and among the Philistines.
verses.ct: He went to war against the Philistines and tore down the walls of Gath, Jabneh, and Ashdod. He also built new towns in the territory around Ashdod and throughout Philistine land.

verses.kjv: And God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gurbaal, and the Mehunims.
verses.web: God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians who lived in Gur Baal, and the Meunim.
verses.ct: God helped him fight the Philistines, the Arabians living in Gurbaal, and the Mehunims.

verses.kjv: And the Ammonites gave gifts to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entering in of Egypt; for he strengthened himself exceedingly.
verses.web: The Ammonites gave tribute to Uzziah. His name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt; for he grew exceedingly strong.
verses.ct: The Ammonites paid tribute to Uzziah, and his reputation spread all the way to the border of Egypt because he had become extremely powerful.

verses.kjv: Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.
verses.web: Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.
verses.ct: Uzziah also built fortified towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, the Valley Gate, and the angle of the wall.

verses.kjv: Also he built towers in the desert, and digged many wells: for he had much cattle, both in the low country, and in the plains: husbandmen also, and vine dressers in the mountains, and in Carmel: for he loved husbandry.
verses.web: He built towers in the wilderness, and dug out many cisterns, for he had much livestock; in the lowland also, and in the plain. He had farmers and vineyard keepers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields, for he loved farming.
verses.ct: He built watchtowers in the wilderness and dug many cisterns, because he owned large herds in both the foothills and the plains. He also had farmers and vineyard workers in the hill country and the fertile lands, because he loved agriculture.

verses.kjv: Moreover Uzziah had an host of fighting men, that went out to war by bands, according to the number of their account by the hand of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king’s captains.
verses.web: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men, who went out to war by bands, according to the number of their reckoning made by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king’s captains.
verses.ct: Uzziah maintained a well-organized army ready for battle. They were organized into divisions based on the count kept by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the command of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.

verses.kjv: The whole number of the chief of the fathers of the mighty men of valour were two thousand and six hundred.
verses.web: The whole number of the heads of fathers’ households, even the mighty men of valor, was two thousand six hundred.
verses.ct: The total number of family leaders over these mighty warriors was 2,600.

verses.kjv: And under their hand was an army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
verses.web: Under their hand was an army, three hundred seven thousand five hundred, who made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
verses.ct: Under their command was an army of 307,500 soldiers trained to fight with great skill, ready to defend the king against any enemy.

verses.kjv: And Uzziah prepared for them throughout all the host shields, and spears, and helmets, and habergeons, and bows, and slings to cast stones.
verses.web: Uzziah prepared for them, even for all the army, shields, spears, helmets, coats of mail, bows, and stones for slinging.
verses.ct: Uzziah equipped the entire army with shields, spears, helmets, coats of armor, bows, and stones for slinging.

verses.kjv: And he made in Jerusalem engines, invented by cunning men, to be on the towers and upon the bulwarks, to shoot arrows and great stones withal. And his name spread far abroad; for he was marvellously helped, till he was strong.
verses.web: In Jerusalem, he made devices, invented by skillful men, to be on the towers and on the battlements, with which to shoot arrows and great stones. His name spread far abroad, because he was marvelously helped until he was strong.
verses.ct: In Jerusalem, he installed war machines designed by skilled engineers on the towers and battlements to launch arrows and hurl large stones. His fame spread far and wide, because God gave him remarkable help until he became very powerful.

verses.kjv: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up to his destruction: for he transgressed against the LORD his God, and went into the temple of the LORD to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
verses.web: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up, so that he did corruptly, and he trespassed against LORD his God; for he went into LORD’s temple to burn incense on the altar of incense.
verses.ct: But once he became powerful, his pride led to his downfall. He sinned against the LORD his God by entering the temple of the LORD to burn incense on the altar of incense.

verses.kjv: And Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him fourscore priests of the LORD, that were valiant men:
verses.web: Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him eighty priests of LORD, who were valiant men.
verses.ct: Azariah the priest followed him inside, along with 80 courageous priests of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they withstood Uzziah the king, and said unto him, It appertaineth not unto thee, Uzziah, to burn incense unto the LORD, but to the priests the sons of Aaron, that are consecrated to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary; for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honour from the LORD God.
verses.web: They resisted Uzziah the king, and said to him, “It isn’t for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to LORD, but for the priests the sons of Aaron, who are consecrated to burn incense. Go out of the sanctuary, for you have trespassed. It will not be for your honor from LORD God.”
verses.ct: They confronted King Uzziah and told him, "It is not your place to burn incense to the LORD, Uzziah! That responsibility belongs only to the priests, the descendants of Aaron, who have been consecrated for this duty. Leave the sanctuary — you have sinned! The LORD God will not honor you for this."

verses.kjv: Then Uzziah was wroth, and had a censer in his hand to burn incense: and while he was wroth with the priests, the leprosy even rose up in his forehead before the priests in the house of the LORD, from beside the incense altar.
verses.web: Then Uzziah was angry. He had a censer in his hand to burn incense, and while he was angry with the priests, the leprosy broke out on his forehead before the priests in LORD’s house, beside the altar of incense.
verses.ct: Uzziah flew into a rage. He was standing there holding a censer, ready to burn incense, and while he was still furious with the priests, leprosy suddenly broke out on his forehead — right there in the LORD's temple, beside the altar of incense.

verses.kjv: And Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked upon him, and, behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out from thence; yea, himself hasted also to go out, because the LORD had smitten him.
verses.web: Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked at him, and behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out quickly from there. Yes, he himself also hurried to go out, because LORD had struck him.
verses.ct: When Azariah the chief priest and all the other priests turned to look at him, they could see the leprosy on his forehead. They rushed him out of the temple immediately, and Uzziah himself hurried to leave, because the LORD had struck him.

verses.kjv: And Uzziah the king was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a several house, being a leper; for he was cut off from the house of the LORD: and Jotham his son was over the king’s house, judging the people of the land.
verses.web: Uzziah the king was a leper to the day of his death, and lived in a separate house, being a leper; for he was cut off from LORD’s house. Jotham his son was over the king’s house, judging the people of the land.
verses.ct: King Uzziah remained a leper for the rest of his life. He had to live in a separate house, completely cut off from the LORD's temple. His son Jotham took charge of the royal palace and governed the people of the land.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, write.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, wrote.
verses.ct: Everything else about Uzziah's reign, from beginning to end, was recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.

verses.kjv: So Uzziah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers in the field of the burial which belonged to the kings; for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: So Uzziah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the field of burial which belonged to the kings, for they said, “He is a leper.” Jotham his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Uzziah died and was buried near his ancestors in a field next to the royal burial ground, because people said, "He was a leper." His son Jotham became king after him.
